name: Marinated Grilled Pork Tenderloin
author: Donna Leigh
summary: This is a wonderful tenderloin that tastes best when marinated for 24 hours.
directions: Whisk honey, soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, ginger, ketchup, garlic, parsley, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and cinnamon in a bowl; pour into a resealable plastic bag
Add pork, coat with marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag
Marinate in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours
Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate
Remove pork from the marinade, and shake off excess
Cook the pork tenderloins on preheated grill until no longer pink in the center, 20 to 30 minutes, turning occasionally
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
